title: Problem 2045_A
statement: You are playing a word game using a standard set of 26 uppercase English letters: A — Z. In this game, you can form vowels and consonants as follows. The letters A, E, I, O, and U can only form a vowel. The letter Y can form either a vowel or a consonant. Each of the remaining letters other than A, E, I, O, U, and Y can only form a consonant. The string NG can form a single consonant when concatenated together. Denote a syllable as a concatenation of a consonant, a vowel, and a consonant in that
